title.label: Love monument valley to my core

The gameplay, while short still holds up. I get sucked into the beauty of the world very much and itâ€™s hard for me to put the phone down while I play it. I have one question though:

I bought Idaâ€™s RED Dream when it first came out, and enjoyed it thoroughly. Love the idea of aids wearing red at the time to help symbolize what the purchase meant. But when I recently redownloaded the game and decided to challenge myself by restarting all my progress, my purchase of Idaâ€™s RED Dream suddenly just became the standred Idaâ€™s Dream. Now the gameplay still remains the same and I still love the chapter, but is it possible for you guys to restore the original version for me? Iâ€™d very much like to have the RED version of Idaâ€™s Dream back because it was symbolic to me on why I bought it. If you canâ€™t, I understand, I just thought Iâ€™d ask first if thatâ€™s possible.

Please respond soon.

title.label: great game... but what the heck!?!?!

content.label: Donâ€™t get me wrong, I love this game. I used to play it with my dad when I was really young, and it would be so hard and we would just mess around with it together. title.label: Was good, but it isnâ€™t anymore

content.label: First off, love(d) the game. Very beautiful, and I like how it tests your knowledge and perspective. But when I got to level 8, the one with the box, I couldnâ€™t get to the purple area. I tried and tried, but eventually I looked up walkthroughs. In these walkthroughs, the box opened up for the people playing the game. I tried doing exactly what they did, but the box never opened up. I had the green part in the exact same orientation, the crow in the purple place out of view, but nothing worked. I looked up walkthroughs for iPads, but it was the same result. If this is fixed, Iâ€™ll change my answer, itâ€™s just EXTREMELY frustrating. Iâ€™ve been stuck for what feels like forever.
I loved this game and itâ€™s fun. I recommend monument valley 2.l also want you to make a monument valley 3.

This game is clever and gorgeous. Iâ€™d go as far to state that this is the best puzzle game for iOS. Others have described this game better than I could but I wanted to add my vote for this perfect game.

Monument Valley is sheer genius. Gorgeous visuals and insightful sound design are paired with an intriguing and thoughtful storyline. These all put this game on another level. It is excellent. I quickly bought all the chapters there were to buy after I played just a few chapters of the first set. Monument Valley is more than a game, but I'm at a loss for an another label to use. It has high replay value if only to wonder at the astounding visuals, excellent soundtrack and mysterious moments.
It was hard but good like a brain puzzle but a game

I already passed it but it takes a long time. The price is very reasonable since there is no adds. The only problem I have is that maybe you could create more levels or other apps because once I finished the game I never opened it up more. I know there is a monument valley two but I already finished that too.
This game has very artistic illusions and are fun to play. It has very varied and vivid colors. It is a very artistic app and a must play!

â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”
       Idaâ€™s mother was queen of birds.(tomb in chapter 9 belongs to Idaâ€™s mother) When she passed away, Ida inherited the throne. In one level, ida is called a thieving  princess by a spirit. This is because Ida stole the sacred monuments. Because of that crime, Ida lost her title as queen of the birds. She wasnâ€™t the only one who suffered loss. The birds also lost their color and more importantly, their wings. The birds hated and blamed Ida. Thatâ€™s why they would screech in her face and block her path in the game. The game is called â€œA Quest For Forgivenessâ€ because Ida wants her former subjects to forgive her. If they donâ€™t forgive her, she will never rule again and her former subjects will be forced to be crows forever. She wants them to forgive her. To make them forgive her, she must return the monuments. When you finish the game, you watch a end scene where Ida and the crows stand together. There is a flash of light, and one crow stands there,
WITH their COLORS AND WINGS. There are more flashes of light, and soon all of them are in the air.They have forgiven Ida. Ida lifts her arms into the air and a crown appears. Her crown. The moment it touches her head, she is in her original form:Queen of the birds. Ida and her subjects then fly away into the sky to start a new life.

I stumbled upon this game, while looking for another game. I'm not much of a gamer, so take that into consideration when reading this. Most games don't hold much interest for me since they are about battling or racing against a clock. If I get involved in a game, it has to be relaxing. This game is abundant in great design, a simple, yet mysterious narrative, and visually amazing problem solving, and a nice, ambient soundtrack. 

I love that it plays on the art of M.C. Escher (a learning opportunity when playing it with my 7 year old.) My son and I actually gasped at certain areas of discovery.

I must underline the fact that 'Ida' doesn't have to physically battle Bosses or have to keep repeating levels from being killed. Yes, I'm talking about you, factory robot!

My two sons, who are both typical gamers, think this game is awesome. We can't wait to savor the additional add-on and Monument Valley 2.

I was very disappointed with this game. If youâ€™re only going to include 10 levels, then it should have been free. The game was fun, but it was also frustrating at the same time. I get that itâ€™s a part of the experience, but not even simple hints were provided.
I love this game. I just finished Monument Valley 2. This time I savored each level. Thank you.

I have played all the games in the series; Monument Valley, Forgotten Shores, Idaâ€™s Dream, and Monument Valley 2. Iâ€™ve read a ton of fan theories and read the Apple Story. I love this game! Itâ€™s beautiful, symbolic, emotional, with ingenious structures and mind boggling puzzles. My heart reaches out to Ida, Totem, Doortem, Ro, and Roâ€™s daughter. Even the though the story is vague, it has enough elements in it to make your heart break at the right moment. I love the way the art develops symbolism.
